title: GDPR Compliance Statement
intro: Keepay (“Keepay”, “we”, “us”, or “our”) is committed to complying with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (“GDPR”), the UK GDPR, and applicable data protection laws. This statement explains how Keepay fulfills its obligations as a data controller and ensures the protection of personal data of users located in the European Union, the United Kingdom, and other applicable jurisdictions.

content: For the purposes of the GDPR, Keepay acts as a Data Controller, meaning we determine how and why personal data is processed.
Keepay processes personal data only when there is a lawful basis under Article 6 GDPR, including:

items: Consent – when you explicitly agree to data processing (e.g. connecting a bank account)
Contractual necessity – to provide our services
Legal obligation – to comply with regulatory requirements
Legitimate interest – limited to security, fraud prevention, and service improvement

content: Consent may be withdrawn at any time without affecting the lawfulness of prior processing.
We strictly adhere to the principles of:

items: Data minimization – collecting only data strictly necessary
Purpose limitation – using data only for clearly defined purposes

content: Financial data accessed via third-party providers (e.g. Plaid) is used exclusively to deliver Keepay’s subscription management features.
We provide users with:

items: Clear information on what data is collected
How data is used and retained
Who data is shared with
How to exercise their rights

content: This information is available in our Privacy Policy, Cookies Policy, and this GDPR statement.
Users located in the EU and UK have the right to:

items: Right of access – obtain a copy of their personal data
Right to rectification – correct inaccurate or incomplete data
Right to erasure (“right to be forgotten”)
Right to restriction of processing
Right to data portability
Right to object to processing
Right to withdraw consent at any time

content: Requests can be made by contacting privacy@keepayapp.com
We respond within 30 days, as required by GDPR.
Keepay retains personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill its purposes.

items: Account data is retained while the account is active
After account is deleted user related data is held within 30 - 90days before permanently deleted
Unactivated accounts are held for 15 days before permanently deleted
Financial data is deleted when accounts are disconnected or closed
Backup data is removed within 30–90 days
Legal retention applies only where required by law

content: Upon deletion, data is permanently erased or anonymized.
We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures, including:

items: HTTPS / TLS encryption
Encryption at rest
Role-based access control
Secure OAuth authentication
Regular monitoring and incident detection

content: These measures are designed to prevent unauthorized access, loss, or disclosure.
Keepay works only with GDPR-compliant processors, including:

items: Financial data aggregators (e.g. Plaid)
Secure hosting and infrastructure providers
Monitoring and security services

content: All processors are bound by:

items: Data Processing Agreements (DPAs)
Confidentiality obligations
Data minimization principles

content: Where personal data is transferred outside the EU or UK, Keepay ensures appropriate safeguards, including:

items: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs)
Adequacy decisions where applicable
Security and access controls

content: In the event of a personal data breach:

items: We will assess the risk promptly
Notify the relevant supervisory authority within 72 hours, where required
Inform affected users without undue delay if there is a high risk to their rights

content: Users have the right to lodge a complaint with their local data protection authority
EU users may contact their national authority
UK users may contact the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO)
We encourage users to contact us first to resolve concerns amicably.
This GDPR Compliance Statement may be updated to reflect legal, technical, or organizational changes.
The latest version will always be available on our website.
